It's simple really, when a melee carry is strong they're usually oppressive due to the amounts of mobility/engage necessary to properly carry.

Example: {{champion:11}}  can chase down and kill that speedy little {{champion:21}} . But if he can catch her out of position with her bonus MS he can obviously catch champions with low mobility even when they're in position because he's able to catch the mobile ones. In fact I'm almost certain that people have said that mobility counters counter immobile champions too because Thresh ult certainly slows down Vayne, but it also cripples Veigar, and Ryze snare certainly locks down Ahri, but it also opens Mordekaiser up to a painful combo he can only hope to mitigate.

The reason for that is that this game is set up in a way that is actively hostile to melee carries - if you use melee carries as "sustained damage dealers via purely auto-attacks".

The reasons for that are plentiful:

- **Burst damage scales.**
This first point is a big one - as a melee champion, it is mandatory to move into the enemy's range of influence to do something. This opens you up to all the enemy's abilities. This is a double hazard for for melee DPS, as they need to stay in that close range for an extended period of time, but the DPS build leaves them squishy by necessity. And scaling burst damage ensures that there will always be enough damage to blow the melee carry up.
DotA doesn't have this problem, as burst damage hardly scales in that game (there is no AP, and cooldown reduction is MUCH more limited). This means that the increased tankiness from base stats will eventually outscale the burst enough for the melee carry to close the distance and get that Lifesteal rolling. Also, BKB exists to help melee carries with not getting blown up - it takes getting damaged by magic completely out of the equation for a short time.
- **No double-dipping.**
In League, a high DPS build is always fairly squishy and susceptible to burst damage. This is due to none of the ADC items giving major defensive stats (even Phantom Dancer only works if you got to auto the burster at least once before he unleashes his damage).
- **Kiting is better.**
The smoothness of the game generated by the lack of turn times contributes as well, as it enables kiting as a ranged ADCs defense tactic - can't hurt what you can't hit, can you?
- **No XP feeding.**
As melees need the tankiness from levels, they cannot afford to share XP. In fact, the class that loses the least effectivity when sharing XP are ranged ADCs, as neither their safety nor their damage output are as dependent on the stat.

Technically, Vi's ult isn't what you counterplay, it's her follow-up, where she has less available mobility and should be easier to kite. The issue right now, though, is that Vi deals a lot of burst damage, and can kill squishies too quickly for them to react properly, unless they blow Flash, but that in itself is kind of necessary for her to function right now, because she'd otherwise never be able to follow up properly. If kiting were less harsh on melee champions, fighters and tanks wouldn't need burst or excessive mobility to be able to have an impact on ranged opponents, but until then, it's always going to be a situation where either the melee champion reaches their ranged target, in which case they auto-win through sheer stats and raw damage, or they don't, and get kited until they die.

Vi main here, offering her thoughts.

The thing with Vi ultimate is that most people who complain about it use their mobility or CC while she is ulting. 
Vi ultimate has two parts, the gap closer and the damage. Ccing her during the gap closer is useless, but if you CC her during the damage, she stays stunned even after her ultimate ends. Most of the burst she's known for comes with the Triforce empowered  E after her ultimate, so stopping that is more effective. For instance, with Ezreal, don't arcane shift until after her ultimate goes off. With an Annie or Ashe, stun her as she reaches you. She will still do damage, but she won't be able to combo off the ultimate.
If your playing a Jinx or Twitch, you have to rely on your team to do this. Jinx is a low mobility ADC, and her lack of peel or escapes is an intended weakness.
If you're  squishy against Vi, stay grouped, because alone she will just wait out the stun or chase you down and kill you. ADCs or mages can't 1v1 divers.
Some very effective counters to Vi are Sivir, because of her spellshield, Tahm Kench, as he can eat whoever she ults and make her useless, Kayle, because they can trade ults, and Shyvana, who, post 6, will always beat her in a 1v1. Fiora can Riposte her ultimate easily, Jax can dodge her E, Tryndamere will just kill her, and Olaf ignores her CC. Fizz, Vladimir, Shaving, Elise, Zed or a Zhonyas all do the same thing. Poppy has a strange interaction that ends the dash portion.
Don't play Jihn or Xerath against any diver. Just don't.

Honestly, its the adc items that scale too well with each other, not the adc kits themselves. This combined with the damage increase from masteriws creates massive damage. What I suggest is nerf adc items but buff the adcs to compensate.

One idea from an older thread is to make the crit from {{item:3031}} and {{item:3087}} unique passives so that they can't stack with each other, decreasing ADC burst damage. Furthermore, removing the crit from {{item:3046}} should do some good, as well as some other changes along those lines. While ADCs are supposed to be the DPS tank killers that do sustained damage while kiting to avoid getting caught out, crit allows them to anihilate squishies and do a lot more damage than they should be. In the same way that removing some AP damage from the game did the game some good (mages received more item diversity and became less oppressive at the same time), removing some crit from the game should do some good as well.

Furthermore, buffing tank masteries is definitely a must. Revert some of the nerfs on Grasp, and change Bond of Stone to something else (I had the idea of armor and mr that stacks each time you get attacked, and at the max of 5 stacks, your next attack slows the target) that isn't utterly useless (buffing BoS is unhealthy in this "shield, heal and peel for the ADC so that they kill everyone" meta).

The problem with removing crit is that is really the big niche for ranged characters, since their abilities tend to suck and, since crit only effects autoattacks, others are unlikely to buy it. I would be fine with the IE, Shiv combo not being a thing anymore, but removing crit from PD would be a ridiculously huge nerf.
